overview:
This class allows you interact with Error Reporting.

First, install @google-cloud/error-reporting with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/error-reporting

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/error-reportingâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var errors = require('@google-cloud/error-reporting')();

Elsewhere

var errors = require('@google-cloud/error-reporting')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/error-reporting are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: populateErrorMessage
methods.description: The Error handler router is responsible for taking an object of some type and and Error message container, analyzing the type of the object and marshalling the object's information into the error message container.

params.name: em
params.description: • an instance of ErrorMessage to marshal object information into

methods.name: populateFromError
methods.description: Extracts error information from an instance of the Error class and marshals that information into the provided instance of error message. This function will check before accessing any part of the error for propety presence but will not check the types of these property values that is instead work that is allocated to the error message instance itself.

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: • the error message instance to have the error information marshaled into

methods.name: populateFromObject
methods.description: Attempts to extract error information given an object as the input for the error. This function will check presence of each property before attempting to access the given property on the object but will not check for type compliance as that is allocated to the instance of the error message itself.

params.name: ob
params.description: • the Object given as the content of the error

params.name: [ob.filePath]
params.description: • the file path and file where the error occurred at

params.name: [ob.lineNumber]
params.description: • the line number where the error occurred at

params.name: [ob.functionName]
params.description: • the function where the error occurred at

params.name: [ob.serviceContext]
params.description: • the service context object of the error

params.name: [ob.serviceContext.version]
params.description: • the version of the application that the error occurred on

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: • the error message instance to marshal error information into
